menuSystem

Class MenuController

  • java.lang.Object
    • menuSystem.MenuController

  • public class MenuController
extends java.lang.Object
    The driver of the menu system Handles the overall display about what the user inputs. Should be complete Note: this class uses a lot of specific numbers that we plan to change to make the menu system resizeable in the future.
    Author:
    Bryton

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static int boardSize
      An integer representation of the board size, it will either be 5 or 7.
      protected static int HEIGHT
      representing the screen height Note: this is half of 720ps height With 22 pixels added to represent the bar that the frame adds
      protected static javax.swing.JFrame masterFrame
      The main frame of the menu system
      protected static javax.swing.JPanel masterPanel
      The main panel of the menu system
      protected static java.util.Stack<Menu> menuStack
      The stack representing the current path of menus the user has viewed
      protected static int numAI
      An integer representation of the number of AI that is going to appear in the game
      protected static int numPlayers
      An integer representation of the number of players that is going to appear in the game
      protected static int WIDTH
      Representing the screen width Note: this is half of 720ps width

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private MenuController()
      Private constructor to ensure the class isn't duplicated

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static void addToStack(Menu menuToAdd)
      Puts the desired menu onto the stack and updates the display
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Testing!
      protected static void removeFromStack()
      go back a menu on the stack and then update the display if the stack only has 1 menu on it, exit the system
      protected static void setnumAI(int newnumAI)
      setter method to change numAI
      protected static void setNumPlayers(int newNumPlayers)
      setter method to change numPlayers
      static void startDisplay()
      the main method of this class, it initializes every variable to the default state sets up the default menu frame and panel deals with the position of the frame starts the display
      protected static void updateDisplay()
      Update the masterPanel to represent the top item of the stack.
      protected static boolean verifyPlayerCount()
      A method to verify that the numAI and numPlayers being set are valid based on the rules of the game.

    • Method Detail

      • addToStack

        protected static void addToStack(Menu menuToAdd)
        Puts the desired menu onto the stack and updates the display
        Parameters:
        menuToAdd - The menu we want to view

      • removeFromStack

        protected static void removeFromStack()
        go back a menu on the stack and then update the display if the stack only has 1 menu on it, exit the system

      • updateDisplay

        protected static void updateDisplay()
        Update the masterPanel to represent the top item of the stack.

      • setnumAI

        protected static void setnumAI(int newnumAI)
        setter method to change numAI
        Parameters:
        newnumAI - the number of AI we are changing to

      • setNumPlayers

        protected static void setNumPlayers(int newNumPlayers)
        setter method to change numPlayers
        Parameters:
        newNumPlayers - the number of players we are changing to

      • verifyPlayerCount

        protected static boolean verifyPlayerCount()
        A method to verify that the numAI and numPlayers being set are valid based on the rules of the game. Sticks the user in an infinite loop until the player counts are valid.
        Returns:
        Check if valid player count

      • startDisplay

        public static void startDisplay()
        the main method of this class, it initializes every variable to the default state sets up the default menu frame and panel deals with the position of the frame starts the display

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Testing!
        Parameters:
        args - not used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - used for the timeUnit testing
